meanings.definition: A loud, sharp noise or slap.
meanings.sent1: The whangs of the door slamming shut startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard the whangs of fireworks in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The whangs of the drumsticks on the drum made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: The whangs of thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The whangs of the hammer hitting the nail were deafening.

meanings.sent1: He whangs the ball with all his might during the game.
meanings.sent2: She whangs the table in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The chef whangs the dough to make it smooth and elastic.
meanings.sent4: The waves whang against the rocks with great force.
meanings.sent5: The boxer whangs his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material used for lashing or binding.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy's belt had intricate whangs on it.
meanings.sent2: She used the whangs to tie the bundle securely.
meanings.sent3: The whangs on the bag added a stylish touch.
meanings.sent4: The whangs on the whip made a distinct sound when cracked.
meanings.sent5: The whangs on the bracelet were beautifully crafted.
